TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MediaDrm extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: MediaDrm can be used to obtain keys for decrypting protected media streams, in conjunction with .

remarks.para: MediaDrm can be used to obtain keys for decrypting protected media streams, in conjunction with . The MediaDrm APIs are designed to support the ISO/IEC 23001-7: Common Encryption standard, but may also be used to implement other encryption schemes.

Encrypted content is prepared using an encryption server and stored in a content library. The encrypted content is streamed or downloaded from the content library to client devices via content servers. Licenses to view the content are obtained from a License Server.
Keys are requested from the license server using a key request. The key response is delivered to the client app, which provides the response to the MediaDrm API.
A Provisioning server may be required to distribute device-unique credentials to the devices.
Enforcing requirements related to the number of devices that may play content simultaneously can be performed either through key renewal or using the secure stop methods.
The following sequence diagram shows the interactions between the objects involved while playing back encrypted content:

The app first constructs and objects. It accesses the DRM-scheme-identifying UUID, typically from metadata in the content, and uses this UUID to construct an instance of a MediaDrm object that is able to support the DRM scheme required by the content. Crypto schemes are assigned 16 byte UUIDs. The method can be used to query if a given scheme is supported on the device.

The app calls to generate a sessionId that will uniquely identify the session in subsequent interactions. The app next uses the MediaDrm object to obtain a key request message and send it to the license server, then provide the server's response to the MediaDrm object.

Once the app has a sessionId, it can construct a MediaCrypto object from the UUID and sessionId. The MediaCrypto object is registered with the MediaCodec in the method to enable the codec to decrypt content.

When the app has constructed , and objects, it proceeds to pull samples from the extractor and queue them into the decoder. For encrypted content, the samples returned from the extractor remain encrypted, they are only decrypted when the samples are delivered to the decoder.

Applications should register for informational events in order to be informed of key state updates during playback or streaming. Registration for these events is done via a call to . In order to receive the respective callback associated with this listener, applications are required to create MediaDrm objects on a thread with its own Looper running (main UI thread by default has a Looper running).

MemberSignature.Value: public Android.Media.MediaDrm.CryptoSession GetCryptoSession (byte[] sessionId, string cipherAlgorithm, string macAlgorithm);
.method public hidebysig instance class Android.Media.MediaDrm/CryptoSession GetCryptoSession(unsigned int8[] sessionId, string cipherAlgorithm, string macAlgorithm) cil managed

Docs.param: the session ID for the session containing keys to be used for encrypt, decrypt, sign and/or verify
the algorithm to use for encryption and decryption ciphers. The algorithm string conforms to JCA Standard Names for Cipher Transforms and is case insensitive. For example "AES/CBC/NoPadding".

the algorithm to use for sign and verify The algorithm string conforms to JCA Standard Names for Mac Algorithms and is case insensitive. For example "HmacSHA256".
The list of supported algorithms for a DRM engine plugin can be obtained using the method with the property name "algorithms".
Docs.summary: Obtain a CryptoSession object which can be used to encrypt, decrypt, sign and verify messages or data using the session keys established for the session using methods and using a session key server.

remarks.para: Obtain a CryptoSession object which can be used to encrypt, decrypt, sign and verify messages or data using the session keys established for the session using methods and using a session key server.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Media.MediaDrm/ProvisionRequest GetProvisionRequest() cil managed

Docs.summary: A provision request/response exchange occurs between the app and a provisioning server to retrieve a device certificate.

remarks.para: A provision request/response exchange occurs between the app and a provisioning server to retrieve a device certificate. If provisionining is required, the EVENT_PROVISION_REQUIRED event will be sent to the event handler. getProvisionRequest is used to obtain the opaque provision request byte array that should be delivered to the provisioning server. The provision request byte array is returned in ProvisionRequest.data. The recommended URL to deliver the provision request to is returned in ProvisionRequest.defaultUrl.

MemberSignature.Value: public byte[] ProvideKeyResponse (byte[] scope, byte[] response);
.method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] ProvideKeyResponse(unsigned int8[] scope, unsigned int8[] response) cil managed

Docs.param: may be a sessionId or keySetId depending on the type of the response. Scope should be set to the sessionId when the response is for either streaming or offline key requests. Scope should be set to the keySetId when the response is for a release request.
the byte array response from the server
Docs.summary: A key response is received from the license server by the app, then it is provided to the DRM engine plugin using provideKeyResponse.

remarks.para: A key response is received from the license server by the app, then it is provided to the DRM engine plugin using provideKeyResponse. When the response is for an offline key request, a keySetId is returned that can be used to later restore the keys to a new session with the method . When the response is for a streaming or release request, null is returned.

Docs.exception: if the response indicates that reprovisioning is required
if the response indicates that the server rejected the request
if required resources are in use

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> QueryKeyStatus(unsigned int8[] sessionId) cil managed

Docs.param: the session ID for the DRM session
Docs.summary: Request an informative description of the key status for the session.

remarks.para: Request an informative description of the key status for the session. The status is in the form of {name, value} pairs. Since DRM license policies vary by vendor, the specific status field names are determined by each DRM vendor. Refer to your DRM provider documentation for definitions of the field names for a particular DRM engine plugin.

Docs.param: the session ID for the DRM session
identifies the saved key set to restore
Docs.summary: Restore persisted offline keys into a new session. keySetId identifies the keys to load, obtained from a prior call to .

remarks.para: Restore persisted offline keys into a new session. keySetId identifies the keys to load, obtained from a prior call to .

Docs.summary: A means of enforcing limits on the number of concurrent streams per subscriber across devices is provided via SecureStop.

remarks.para: A means of enforcing limits on the number of concurrent streams per subscriber across devices is provided via SecureStop. This is achieved by securely monitoring the lifetime of sessions.
Information from the server related to the current playback session is written to persistent storage on the device when each MediaCrypto object is created.

In the normal case, playback will be completed, the session destroyed and the Secure Stops will be queried. The app queries secure stops and forwards the secure stop message to the server which verifies the signature and notifies the server side database that the session destruction has been confirmed. The persisted record on the client is only removed after positive confirmation that the server received the message using releaseSecureStops().

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
